item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, May 12, 2025 at 3:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. A community-led fork of Organic Maps (165 points | 91 comments)
2. University of Texas-led team solves a big problem for fusion energy (93 points | 36 comments)
3. Ruby 3.5 Feature: Namespace on read (57 points | 19 comments)
4. Spade Hardware Description Language (52 points | 18 comments)
5. Embeddings Are Underrated (3 points | discuss)
6. Plain Vanilla Web (1289 points | 599 comments)
7. Universe expected to decay in 10⁷⁸ years, much sooner than previously thought (58 points | 76 comments)
8. I ruined my vacation by reverse engineering WSC (278 points | 141 comments)
9. The FTC puts off enforcing its 'click-to-cancel' rule (91 points | 40 comments)
10. Continuous glucose monitors reveal variable glucose responses to the same meals (34 points | 14 comments)
11. A Typical Workday at a Japanese Hardware Tool Store [video] (51 points | 9 comments)
12. US Copyright Office found AI companies breach copyright. Its boss was fired (262 points | 133 comments)
13. Spark AI (YC W24) Is Hiring a Full Stack Engineer in San Francisco ( | hide)
14. Gig Companies Violate Workers Rights (77 points | 19 comments)
15. Optimizing My Hacker News Experience (8 points | 1 comment)
16. Intellect-2 Release: The First 32B Model Trained Through Globally Distributed RL (177 points | 54 comments)
17. Continuous Thought Machines (245 points | 25 comments)
18. CrowdStrike CEO cuts his voting power by 92% with unexplained gifts (78 points | 30 comments)
19. Show HN: CLI that spots fake GitHub stars, risky dependencies and licence traps (11 points | 4 comments)
20. Making PyPI's test suite faster (106 points | 29 comments)
21. Armbian Updates: OMV support, boot improvents, Rockchip optimizations (48 points | 9 comments)
22. Implicit UVs: Real-time semi-global parameterization of implicit surfaces [pdf] (22 points | 2 comments)
23. Why Bell Labs Worked (276 points | 190 comments)
24. Car companies are in a billion-dollar software war (399 points | 694 comments)
25. Absolute Zero Reasoner (107 points | 21 comments)
26. High-school shop students attract skilled-trades job offers (234 points | 388 comments)
27. Scraperr – A Self Hosted Webscraper (232 points | 78 comments)
28. Writing an LLM from scratch, part 13 – attention heads are dumb (320 points | 61 comments)
29. Ask HN: Cursor or Windsurf? (218 points | 307 comments)
30. Title of work deciphered in sealed Herculaneum scroll via digital unwrapping (228 points | 111 comments)
